60 #define PV_INIT_SIGNAL_HANDLER() \
61  void CatchCtrlC( int aSig ) { extern int gStop; gStop = 1; } \
62  int InitHandler() { signal( SIGINT, CatchCtrlC ); return 1; } \
63  int gInit = InitHandler(); \
64  int gStop = 0; \

69 inline int PvKbHit(void)
70 {
71  struct termios oldt, newt;
72  int ch;
73  int oldf;
74  extern int gStop;
75 
76  if( gStop )
77  {
78  return 1;
79  }
80 
81  tcgetattr(STDIN_FILENO, &oldt);
82  newt = oldt;
83  newt.c_lflag &= ~(ICANON | ECHO);
84  tcsetattr(STDIN_FILENO, TCSANOW, &newt);
85  oldf = fcntl(STDIN_FILENO, F_GETFL, 0);
86  fcntl(STDIN_FILENO, F_SETFL, oldf | O_NONBLOCK);
87 
88  ch = getchar();
89 
90  tcsetattr(STDIN_FILENO, TCSANOW, &oldt);
91  fcntl(STDIN_FILENO, F_SETFL, oldf);
92 
93  if(ch != EOF)
94  {
95  ungetc(ch, stdin);
96  return 1;
97  }
98 
99  return 0;
100 }
101 
102 inline int PvGetChar()
103 {
104  extern int gStop;
105  if( gStop )
106  {
107  return 0;
108  }
109 
110  return getchar();
111 }
112 
113 inline void PvWaitForKeyPress()
114 {
115  while ( !PvKbHit() )
116  {
117  usleep( 10000 );
118  }
119 
120  PvGetChar(); // Flush key buffer for next stop
121 }
122 
123 inline uint64_t PvGetTickCountMs()
124 {
125  timeval ts;
126  gettimeofday( &ts, 0 );
127 
128  uint64_t lTickCount = (int64_t)(ts.tv_sec * 1000LL + ( ts.tv_usec / 1000LL ) );
129 
130  return lTickCount;
131 }
132 
133 inline void PvSleepMs( uint32_t aSleepTime )
134 {
135  usleep( aSleepTime * 1000 );
136 }

138 class PvMutex
139 {
140 public:
141  PvMutex() { pthread_mutex_init( &mMutex, NULL ); }
142  ~PvMutex() { pthread_mutex_destroy( &mMutex ); }
143 
144  void Lock() { pthread_mutex_lock( &mMutex ); }
145  void Unlock() { pthread_mutex_unlock( &mMutex ); }
146 
147 private:
148  pthread_mutex_t mMutex;
149 };

206 class PvMutex
207 {
208 public:
209  PvMutex() { mMutex = ::CreateMutex( NULL, FALSE, NULL ); }
210  ~PvMutex() { ::CloseHandle( mMutex ); }
211 
212  void Lock() { ::WaitForSingleObject( mMutex, INFINITE ); }
213  void Unlock() { ::ReleaseMutex( mMutex ); }
214 
215 private:
216  HANDLE mMutex;
217 };

223 inline void PvFlushKeyboard()
224 {
225  while( PvKbHit() )
226  {
227  PvGetChar();
228  }
229 }

241 inline const PvDeviceInfo* PvSelectDevice( PvSystem& aSystem )
242 {
243  PvResult lResult;
244  const PvDeviceInfo *lSelectedDI = NULL;
245 #ifdef _UNIX_
246  extern int gStop;
247 #endif
248 
249  cout << endl << "Detecting devices." << endl;
250 
251  while( 1 )
252  {
253 
254 #ifdef _UNIX_
255  if( gStop )
256  {
257  return NULL;
258  }
259 #endif
260  aSystem.Find();
261 
262  // Detect, select device.
263  vector<const PvDeviceInfo *> lDIVector;
264  for ( uint32_t i = 0; i < aSystem.GetInterfaceCount(); i++ )
265  {
266  const PvInterface *lInterface = dynamic_cast<const PvInterface *>( aSystem.GetInterface( i ) );
267  if ( lInterface != NULL )
268  {
269  cout << " " << lInterface->GetDisplayID().GetAscii() << endl;
270  for ( uint32_t j = 0; j < lInterface->GetDeviceCount(); j++ )
271  {
272  const PvDeviceInfo *lDI = dynamic_cast<const PvDeviceInfo *>( lInterface->GetDeviceInfo( j ) );
273  if ( lDI != NULL )
274  {
275  lDIVector.push_back( lDI );
276  cout << "[" << ( lDIVector.size() - 1 ) << "]" << "\t" << lDI->GetDisplayID().GetAscii() << endl;
277  }
278  }
279  }
280  }
281 
282  if( lDIVector.size() == 0)
283  {
284  cout << "No device found!" << endl;
285  }
286 
287  cout << "[" << lDIVector.size() << "] to abort" << endl;
288  cout << "[" << ( lDIVector.size() + 1 ) << "] to search again" << endl << endl;
289 
290  cout << "Enter your action or device selection?" << endl;
291  cout << ">";
292 
293  // Read device selection, optional new IP address.
294  uint32_t lIndex = 0;
295  cin >> lIndex;
296  if( lIndex == lDIVector.size() )
297  {
298  // We abort the selection process.
299  return NULL;
300  }
301  else if ( lIndex < lDIVector.size() )
302  {
303  // The device is selected
304  lSelectedDI = lDIVector[ lIndex ];
305  break;
306  }
307  }
308 
309 #ifndef WIN32
310  // Flush the keyboard buffer so subsequent !kbhit() will work
311  PvFlushKeyboard();
312 #endif // WIN32
313 
314  // If the IP Address valid?
315  if ( lSelectedDI->IsConfigurationValid() )
316  {
317  cout << endl;
318  return lSelectedDI;
319  }
320 
321  // Ask the user for a new IP address.
322  cout << "The IP configuration of the device is not valid." << endl;
323  cout << "Which IP address should be assigned to the device?" << endl;
324  cout << ">";
325 
326  // Read new IP address.
327  string lNewIPAddress;
328  cin >> lNewIPAddress;
329  if ( !lNewIPAddress.length() )
330  {
331  return NULL;
332  }
333 
334 #ifndef WIN32
335  // Flush the keyboard buffer so subsequent !kbhit() will work
336  PvFlushKeyboard();
337 #endif // WIN32
338 
339  const PvDeviceInfoGEV* lDeviceGEV = dynamic_cast<const PvDeviceInfoGEV *>( lSelectedDI );
340  if ( lDeviceGEV != NULL )
341  {
342  // Force new IP address.
343  lResult = PvDeviceGEV::SetIPConfiguration( lDeviceGEV->GetMACAddress().GetAscii(), lNewIPAddress.c_str(),
344  lDeviceGEV->GetSubnetMask().GetAscii(), lDeviceGEV->GetDefaultGateway().GetAscii() );
345  if ( !lResult.IsOK() )
346  {
347  cout << "Unable to force new IP address." << endl;
348  return NULL;
349  }
350  }
351 
352  // Wait for the device to come back on the network.
353  int lTimeout;
354  while( 1 )
355  {
356 #ifdef _UNIX_
357  if( gStop )
358  {
359  return NULL;
360  }
361 #endif
362  lTimeout = 10;
363  while( lTimeout )
364  {
365 #ifdef _UNIX_
366  if( gStop )
367  {
368  return NULL;
369  }
370 #endif
371 
372  aSystem.Find();
373 
374  vector<const PvDeviceInfo *> lDIVector;
375  for ( uint32_t i = 0; i < aSystem.GetInterfaceCount(); i++ )
376  {
377  const PvInterface *lInterface = aSystem.GetInterface( i );
378  for ( uint32_t j = 0; j < lInterface->GetDeviceCount(); j++ )
379  {
380  if ( lInterface->GetDeviceInfo( j )->GetType() == PvDeviceInfoTypeGEV )
381  {
382  const PvDeviceInfoGEV *lDI = dynamic_cast<const PvDeviceInfoGEV*>( lInterface->GetDeviceInfo( j ) );
383  if ( lDI != NULL )
384  {
385  if( lNewIPAddress == lDI->GetIPAddress().GetAscii() )
386  {
387  cout << endl;
388  return lDI;
389  }
390  }
391  }
392  }
393  }
394  PvSleepMs( 1000 );
395 
396  lTimeout--;
397  }
398 
399  cout << "The device " << lNewIPAddress << " was not located. Do you want to continue waiting? yes or no" << endl;
400  cout << ">";
401 
402  string lAnswer;
403  cin >> lAnswer;
404  if ( ( lAnswer == "n" ) || ( lAnswer == "no" ) )
405  {
406  break;
407  }
408  }
409 
410  cout << endl;
411  return NULL;
412 }
413 
414 inline bool ParseOptionFlag( int aCount, const char ** aArgs, const char *aOption, bool *aValue = NULL )
415 {
416  string lOption = aOption;
417  for ( int i = 1; i < aCount; i++ )
418  {
419  string lString = aArgs[i];
420  size_t lPos = lString.find( aOption );
421  if ( lPos != string::npos )
422  {
423  if ( aValue != NULL )
424  {
425  *aValue = true;
426  }
427 
428  return true;
429  }
430  }
431 
432  return false;
433 }
434 
435 template <class T>
436 inline bool ParseOption( int aCount, const char ** aArgs, const char *aOption, T &aValue )
437 {
438  string lOption = aOption;
439  lOption += "=";
440  for ( int i = 1; i < aCount; i++ )
441  {
442  string lString = aArgs[i];
443 
444  size_t lPos = lString.find( aOption );
445  if ( lPos != string::npos )
446  {
447  if ( lString.size() > lOption.size() )
448  {
449  string lParameter = lString.substr( lOption.size(), ( lString.size() - lOption.size() ) + 1 );
450  istringstream iss( lParameter, istringstream::in );
451  iss >> aValue;
452  return true;
453  }
454  }
455  }
456 
457  return false;
458 }
